channel.title: Cache Problems! Acheron Source/client/cache!
channel.description:
Hi I'm having Problems with my cache downloader, I just can't get it to download the cache with all the work on it.All my customs don't work without the cache, So it's a must have, I've done everything i should have, Make the cache a zip, upload it to drop box, Change dl=0 to dl=1 And still nothing works, The Original link said something like https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com And i don't know if i need to do this to my link, but if so i don't know how! If this is an Easy fix please help me For the person who is willing to help i am willing to pay!
Skype : robbi.grundy

item.title: Cache Problems! Acheron Source/client/cache!
item.dc:creator: @robbi12345 robbi12345
item.description:
@robbi12345 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:554313”]It’s easier if you convert the dropbox url to the ‘old’ format (Back when they allowed sharing the instant download links).
Let’s say this is your dropbox url:

Dropbox

Dropbox - Error

Dropbox is a free service that lets you bring your photos, docs, and videos anywhere and share them easily. Never email yourself a file again!


(Not a real url)
What you would do is replace the first part of it (up to .com) with this:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com

So now the url looks like:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/10374349357/something/something.jar

If the above url (last one) was a real link, and not one I just typed up randomly, it would instantly download “something.jar” upon clicking it.[/quote]

thank you!

Read full topic

item.title: Cache Problems! Acheron Source/client/cache!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It’s easier if you convert the dropbox url to the ‘old’ format (Back when they allowed sharing the instant download links).
Let’s say this is your dropbox url:

Dropbox

Dropbox - Error

Dropbox is a free service that lets you bring your photos, docs, and videos anywhere and share them easily. Never email yourself a file again!


(Not a real url)
What you would do is replace the first part of it (up to .com) with this:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com

So now the url looks like:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/10374349357/something/something.jar

If the above url (last one) was a real link, and not one I just typed up randomly, it would instantly download “something.jar” upon clicking it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache Problems! Acheron Source/client/cache!
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

Paying for help is not allowed in this section.

"7. Offering a reward for someones help is not allowed, help is free on this community. "

See here: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,331370.0.html

None the less, go to your Dropbox download, click and hold on the download button, drag it into the upper bar of your browser (to create a new tab opening the link specified by the button). Copy the link given (at the URL-bar). That’d be your link for downloading the Cache, don’t forget the “dl” after the “https://”. I wouldn’t recommend Dropbox tho, because of its deficient bandwith. (Cache downloading will be slow - but works).

Read full topic
